definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: This salesman demonstrated how to cook with a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 这个倾销员当众演示如何用压力锅煮东西。

sentences.english: Then the lovely young mother showed the signet ring as proof.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻又迷人的母亲当众出示了图章戒指以作证明。

sentences.english: When I was pregnant, I could not have imagined breastfeeding in public.
sentences.chinese: 怀孕的时候，我压根就没想过当众哺乳的事情。

sentences.english: After that day, I went to the temple and I reopened it before the people.
sentences.chinese: 那天之后，我来到神殿，并当众重开了神殿的大门。

sentences.english: Are you afraid of looking a fool in public - of being a subject of ridicule?
sentences.chinese: 你害怕当众出丑，成为大家的笑料吗？

sentences.english: She didn't feel a bit nervous though it was the first time she'd spoken in public.
sentences.chinese: 她虽是第一次当众讲话，却一点都不发慌。

sentences.english: Don't unbutton or take off your clothes.
sentences.chinese: 不可解开钮扣或当众脱衣。

sentences.english: Mary likes to show people up in public.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽喜欢使别人当众出丑。

sentences.english: He declared the cancellation of those debts in public.
sentences.chinese: 他当众宣布那些债务一风吹。

sentences.english: She does not like to contradict her husband in public.
sentences.chinese: 她不喜欢当众与丈夫顶嘴。

sentences.english: YiXin tore up the contract in public, and that ended the cooperation with letters.
sentences.chinese: 毅昕当众把合约撕毁，且声言结束与信佳的合作。
他说，我们要当众尝试一些新东西。

sentences.english: I am not really good at public speaking.
sentences.chinese: 我一直不善于当众发言。

sentences.english: That’s how you should pay people, Ivey publicly replied.
sentences.chinese: 那应成为你的支付方式，艾维当众说道。

sentences.english: I admit now that Iwas wrong, and Iam ready to acknowledge it in front of everyone.
sentences.chinese: 现在我承认自己错了，并准备当众认错。

sentences.english: Mark was very angry because Jane put him down before everyone.
sentences.chinese: 马克非常生气，因为简使他当众出丑。

definition: in front of/in the presence of
in the middle of the street/facing the street
see 萬目睽睽|万目睽睽[wan4 mu4 kui2 kui2]
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to be put on the spot/to find oneself in an awkward situation
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
